alert.note: Alert for Wallowa (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 13 at 9:06AM PDT until June 15 at 12:00PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PDT TUESDAY... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Oregon, including the following county, Wallowa. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 900 AM PDT, gauge reports along with river forecasts indicated the Grande Ronde River at Troy will crest just above flood stage around 10 PM PDT. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Troy. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
